CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "Jackie Robinson - Bats for Brotherhood - Jackie Robinson, 1954 chairman of the Commission on Community Organizations of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, is undertaking a nation-wide tour building interest in Brotherhood Week, to be celebrated Feb. 21-28. He was in Pittsburgh Monday.  Other stops include Detroit, South Bend, St. Louis, Tulsa and Los Angeles.  Louis A. Radelat, director of the commission, accompanied Jackie. Headliners - Among those present at the Brotherhood in Sports Luncheon by the Jaycees at the Sheraton Hotel were Sid Gordon, Pirate infielder; Jackie, Judge Samuel A. Weiss, Brotherhood Week chairman, and Donald W. (Dudley) Moore, Duquesne University basketball coach."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Pirates baseball player Sid Gordon, Brooklyn Dodgers player Jackie Robinson, Judge Samuel A. Weiss, and Duquesne University basketball coach Donald W. "Dudley" Moore, standing in Sheraton Hotel for Jaycees luncheon
